Package aa.test.selenium

Class ZZChangePasswordTest

java.lang.Object
aa.test.utils.AASeleniumManager
aa.test.selenium.ZZChangePasswordTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class) class ZZChangePasswordTest extends AASeleniumManager
Test password changes. Test several scenarios for invalid password change and a scenario for valid password change.

  • Method Details

    • clearInputs

      private void clearInputs()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: Clear input fields for the old password and the new password

    • navigateToChangePassword

      private void navigateToChangePassword()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: Navigate to Change password. Given the test user is logged in Then
 navigate to Change password page

    • init

      @Test @Order(1) void init()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: Initialize the tests. Given the testing just started 
 Then log in the test user 
 And navigate to Change password page 
 And check the Change password button is disabled when inputs are clear.

    • invalidPasswordChangeNewEmpty

      @Test @Order(2) void invalidPasswordChangeNewEmpty()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: New password is empty. 
 
 Given the test user is on the Change password page 
 Then fill in the old password only 
 And check Change password button is disabled 
 And notices of what's wrong are on the page

    • invalidPasswordChangeOldEmpty

      @Test @Order(3) void invalidPasswordChangeOldEmpty()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: Old password is empty. 
 
 Given the test user is on the Change password page 
 Then fill in the new password only 
 And check Change password button is disabled 
 And notices of what's wrong are on the page.

    • invalidPasswordChangeNewShort

      @Test @Order(4) void invalidPasswordChangeNewShort()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: New password is short. 
 
 Given the test user is on the Change password page 
 Then fill in the old password correctly and new password with the string too short 
 And check Change password button is disabled 
 And notices of what's wrong are on the page

    • invalidPasswordChangeNewWeak

      @Test @Order(5) void invalidPasswordChangeNewWeak()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: New password is weak. 
 
 Given the test user is on the Change password page 
 Then fill in the old password correctly and a weak new password 
 And check Change password button is disabled 
 And notices of what's wrong are on the page

    • invalidPasswordChangeBothSame

      @Test @Order(6) void invalidPasswordChangeBothSame()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: Old and new passwords are the same. 
 
 Given the test user is on the Change password page 
 Then fill in the old password and the new password with the same string 
 And check Change password button is disabled 
 And notices of what's wrong are on the page

    • validPasswordChange

      @Test @Order(7) void validPasswordChange()
       Feature: Test password change
 
 Scenario: Valid password change. 
 
 Given the test user is on the Change password page 
 Then fill in the old password and the new password correctly
 And check the page for notices 
 And submit the change 
 And assert the user is now on the login page 
 And assert client-snackbars is there with the correct message 
 And log in again with the new password 
 And revert the password change via the same process 
 And check that it's possible to log in with the old credentials
